By leasing multifunctional devices with service - you should understood as the delivery of multifunctional devices to the locations indicated by the Ordering Party, including their bringing, assembly, installation, configuration and commissioning, along with conducting training in operation for designated employees of the Ordering Party, and then putting the devices into use as part of a monthly subscription, with full service, including: in particular maintenance, repairs, replacement of parts, delivery of consumables (excluding paper) and maintenance devices in full technical condition, in order to produce the agreed volume of prints for the duration of the Implementation Agreement. 2) The Ordering Party requires that the subject of the order be covered by the manufacturer's warranty for a minimum period of 48 months, i.e. throughout duration of the Implementation Agreement. 3) A detailed description of the subject of the order (OPZ) is attached as Annex No. 10 to the SWZ. 4) The implementation conditions are included in the template of the Framework Agreement - Annex No. 8 to the SWZ and the template of the Implementation Agreement - Annex No. 9 to the SWZ. 5)Devices multifunctional, the lease of which will be the subject of the Executive Agreement, will be brand new, unused and technically efficient, manufactured in accordance with the standards in force in Poland and the European Union, will be.... Published Date: 2025-12-24. Closing Date: 2026-01-22. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: MINISTRY OF AGRICULTURE AND RURAL DEVELOPMENT. Summary: Modernization of the E-Logbook System Resulting from the Amendment to Control Regulation 1224/2009 and the Implementing Regulation Assigned to It.. Description: 1. The subject of the order is the modernization of the E-logbook System resulting from the amendment to Control Regulation 1224/2009 and the implementing regulation assigned to it. EU Member States are obliged to establish and operate monitoring centers fisheries, whose main task is to monitor fishing activities and implement appropriate control systems enabling proper supervision of the proper conduct of fishing. The fisheries administration uses many programs enabling the implementation of the above-mentioned purposes, but the key is the electronic fishing log software "e-logbook system". above the system contains all data regarding the register of fishing vessels, catch records, data validation, and allocations fishing quotas, register of violations, etc. Modernization of the system includes the costs of development work, introducing required software modifications, and introducing changes to the computer program after its launch in the customer's environment. Most often it has a purpose changing its operational, system and performance features. 2. The subject of the order will be completed within 2,035 man-hours. Modernization of the E-logbook System resulting from the amendment to Control Regulation 1224/2009 and the assigned implementing regulation. 1. The subject of the order is the modernization of the E-logbook System resulting from the amendment to Control Regulation 1224/2009 and the implementing regulation assigned to it. Part 1 of the order Purchase of a backup server as part of the project entitled Cybersecure local government: 1) The subject of the order is the delivery, installation and configuration of a modern data backup server - 1 piece, implemented in the form of a hardware appliance. The system must meet the requirements for high efficiency, reliability and security of stored data. The ordering party expects that the solution will enable management and backup copies at the level of disks, files and folders, and also support for virtual machines and UEFI/GPT-based systems. The system should offer the functionality of data replication to multiple locations, support for deduplication and compression mechanisms, as well as cooperation with volume shadow copy services (VSS). It is crucial ensuring business continuity and eliminating single points of failure, as well as the availability of service in the Polish language version. Additionally, the system must have monitoring mechanisms, automatic notification of task status and the possibility of integration with various IT environments, and also ensures scalability as the amount of data and devices to be protected increases.2) The contractor is.... input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: ASTRONOMICAL CENTER NICOLAUS COPERNICUS POLISH ACADEMY OF SCIENCES. Summary: Manufacturing and Delivery of Feb Controller Systems (Hk-Feb-6V1). Description: The subject of the order is the manufacture and delivery of 11,800 pieces of FEB controller systems (HK-FEB-6V1) intended for the multi-PMT modules of the long-range detector of the Hyper-Kamiokande experiment, in accordance with the design documentation HK-FEB-6V1-Gerber.zip. Scope of the order includes in particular: making PCBs from FR4 material with Tg parameters ≥ 155 °C, based on the provided Gerber files, full electrical test of the made boards, purchase of all electronic components in accordance with the BOM list, assembly. machine SMD according to the provided documentation, soldering using "no-clean" technology or with ultrasonic cleaning, depanelization by cutting out and individual packaging of each board, delivery of complete FEB systems. As part of the order fulfillment The contractor is obliged to produce a trial batch (200 pieces) within 30 days from the date of signing the contract and deliver the entire order within 4 months from signing the contract. All items must be new, free from defects in materials and materials legal regulations, made in accordance with technical standards and delivered with the required documentation in Polish or English. The minimum warranty period is 12 months. The contractor ensures transport and collection of the devices during the warranty period on his own cost if repair is not possible at the Ordering Party's premises. Delivery is made to the Ordering Party's address in accordance with INCOTERMS 2020 - DDP, with full insurance on the part of the Contractor. Detailed.... Published Date: 2025-12-23. Closing Date: 2026-01-22. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

The Ordering Party requires that the prices of the offered medicines are no higher than the official prices specified in Art. 9 section 1 and 2 of the Act of May 12, 2011 on the reimbursement of medicines and foodstuffs.... Quantities of products given in unit price form are indicative and the Ordering Party has the right to order smaller quantities, but not less than 60% of the contract/task value. 4. The Ordering Party requires that the delivered products have a shelf life of at least 12 months, counting from the date of delivery to the Ordering Party's registered office. 6.Does not allow the submission of offers variants and also covering only some items from the task. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: JANIKOWO COMMUNE. Summary: Development of the Selective Municipal Waste Collection System in the Janikowo Commune. Description: The subject of the order includes the implementation of the task entitled: "Development of the Selective Municipal Waste Collection system in the Janikowo Commune". The scope of the order includes the delivery and implementation of the Selective Municipal Waste Collection System in the commune. Janikowo, consisting in the delivery and installation of 5 machines for waste segregation. The location at specific points in the Wilkoński estate in Janikowo is intended to facilitate access and convenience for residents to dispose of sorted waste, and thus thus encouraging them even more to care for the environment. The scope of the order also includes the construction of a composting plant for biodegradable green waste and a reloading point for separated waste, delivery and installation of a truck scale with a container. office space and construction works consisting in hardening the area in accordance with the design documentation and bill of quantities. These documents (design documentation and bill of quantities) complement each other. The bill of quantities provided applies only to works related to construction of a composting plant. The hardening of the area in the bill of quantities does not take into account the hardening of the area for waste disposal machines. The delivery and installation of machines should be priced based on the description of the subject of the order. Development of the Selective Municipal Waste Collection System in the area Janikowo commune Doc Title: Development of the Selective Municipal Waste Collection System in the Janikowo Commune Contract Type: supplies. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: SOCIAL SERVICES CENTER IN KOSZALIN. Summary: Rehabilitation Equipment Rental - Part And. Description: The subject of the order is the comprehensive implementation of the service Task 1: Rental of rehabilitation equipment in the form of wheelchairs. The scope of the service includes: 1) equipment rental for a period of up to 6 months, 2) equipment delivery (delivery of equipment by the Contractor to place of residence of the Recipient indicated in the Service Order Card),3) installation of equipment (if the situation requires it, the Contractor installs the equipment at the Recipient's place of residence),4) learning how to use the equipment (providing the Recipient with the necessary information and operating instructions to use the rehabilitation equipment), 5) collection of the rehabilitation equipment (after the end of the rental period, the Contractor collects the equipment from the Recipient's place of residence, the collection date is the last day of renting the equipment indicated in the Service Order Card), 6) technical inspection and maintenance between rentals, servicing of the equipment while in use by the Recipient), 7) cleaning and disinfection of the equipment after each receipt. A detailed description of the subject of the order can be found in Appendix No. 6a to the SWZ.. Published Date: 2025-12-23. Closing Date: 2025-12-31. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: COAL MINING MUSEUM IN ZABRZE. Summary: Construction and Delivery of Two Sets of Boats and their Retrieval System for the Mgw in Zabrze. Description: The subject of the order is: "Manufacture and delivery of two sets of boats and their retrieval system for the needs of the MGW in Zabrze", which are a component of the transport system on the waterway located in the workings of the Main Key Heritage Adit. Within In order to complete the above task, two sets of boats must be made, delivered and launched, consisting of two boats connected together, made on the basis of a design owned by the Ordering Party, approved by the Polish Register of Shipping S.A. constituting Attachment No. 1 to the description of the subject of the order, including the delivery and installation of the boat recovery system in the designated location in accordance with the project constituting Attachment No. 2. As part of the implementation of the above task, all costs should also be calculated materials necessary to complete the electrical installation to power the battery charging system located on board the boats in question and the boat steering system in the port. A vision is possible to prepare the offer local under the conditions set out in the SWZ. A detailed description of the subject of the order is included in Annex No. 2 to the SWZ with attachments. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: MUNICIPALITY OF THE CITY OF SOCHACZEW. Summary: Delivery of Mini and Midi Electric Buses with the Construction of a Charging Station for the Public Transportation Needs of the City of Sochaczew. Description: 1. Description: Development of digital services at the Specialist Hospital in Brzozów Podkarpacki Oncology Center as part of the D1.1.2 investment Accelerating the processes of digital transformation of health care through further... Development of digital services at the Specialist Hospital in Brzozów Podkarpackie Oncology Center as part of the D1.1.2 investment Accelerating the processes of digital transformation of health care through further development of digital services in health care. The subject of the order is the supply of computer systems and software for the Specialist Hospital in Brzozów, Podkarpackie Oncology Center. Fr. B. Markiewicz, including: Part 1 - Purchase of a database environment with database migration. Part 2 - Delivery of computer equipment. Part 3 - Delivery computers for the operating room. Part 4 - Delivery of the backup system. Part 5 - Delivery of network equipment and licenses. Part 6 - Antivirus software delivery. A detailed description of the subject of the order can be found in Annex No. 1 to the SWZ. List the required subjective and objective documents are included in the specifications of the contract terms. These means of evidence are subject to supplementation. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: PROVINCIAL HEADQUARTERS OF THE STATE FIRE SERVICE IN POZNAŃ. Summary: Command and Communications Vehicle (Company Command Post) - 9 Pieces. Description: The subject of the order is the delivery of nine brand new command and communication vehicles (company command posts). The subject of the order was divided into parts. The Ordering Party allows in accordance with Art. 91 section 1 of the Public Procurement Law folding partial offers. An offer may be submitted for one or two lots. The Ordering Party does not limit the number of parts of the contract for which an order may be awarded to one Contractor. Offers in each part of the order will be examined and assessed separately, i.e.: 1) Part A - delivery of 4 command and communication cars (company command posts), 2) Part B - delivery of 3 command and communication cars (company command posts). 3) Part C - delivery of 2 cars command and communications (company command posts). A detailed description and method of implementing individual parts of the order is included in the OPZ, i.e.: 1) for part A of the order in Annex No. 3A to the SWZ, 2) for part B of the order in Annex No. 3B to SWZ, 3) for part C of the order in Annex No. 3c to the SWZ. The Ordering Party envisages the use of the so-called reverse procedure referred to in Art. 139 section 1 of the Public Procurement Law, i.e. the Ordering Party will first examine and evaluate the offers, and then qualify them subjective evaluation of the Contractor whose offer was rated the highest, in terms of the lack of grounds for exclusion and the fulfillment of the conditions for participation in the proceedings. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: INSTITUTE OF MOTHER AND CHILD. Summary: Purchase of Newborn Screening Kits for Severe Congenital Immunodeficiencies and Spinal Muscle Atrophy (Scid/Sma). Description: PURCHASE OF NEWBORN SCREENING KITS FOR SEVERE CONGENITAL IMMUNODEFICIENCIES AND SPINAL MUSCLE Atrophy (SCID/SMA) 1. Reagent kits for newborn screening for spinal muscular atrophy and congenital deficiencies immunity, including SCID and hypogammglobulinemia, in the number of 362,880 determinations on microplates containing 96 wells each. The kits are based on real-time quantitative PCR and enable simultaneous assessment of the presence of homozygous exon deletion. 7 of the SMN1 gene and quantification of the number of TREC and KREC molecules. The kits must contain: appropriate controls and a set of samples enabling the generation of a curve for the quantification of the number of TREC and KREC molecules; reagents and plates necessary for DNA isolation for testing purposes; reagents containing polymerase and oligonucleotides enabling the identification of exon 7 of the SMN1, TREC gene and KREC and the reference gene. 2. When selecting the most advantageous offer, the Ordering Party reserves the right to: possibility of reducing the purchase of reagents, but not more than by 20% of the above-mentioned the subject of the order, in the event of exceeding the amount allocated for the execution of the order or objective and justified circumstances, in particular reduction expected number of births and tests.. 3. The Contractor is obliged to deliver sets packed with 96 markings or more - in multiples of 96 markings (1 plate). 4. Pursuant to Art. 257 of the Public Procurement Law. Order.... input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: METRO WARSZAWSKIE SP. Z O. O.. Summary: Delivery of Parts for the Electronic System of Inspiro Vehicles.. Description: 1. The subject of the Order is the supply of parts for the electronic system of Inspiro vehicles, divided into 5 Tasks. 2. The Subject of the Order includes the delivery of parts indicated in the "List of ordered parts", constituting Annex No. 1 to the Specification Technical (hereinafter: "ST"), constituting Annex No. 1 to the SWZ and being its integral part. 3. The Ordering Party requires the execution of the Subject of the Order in batches according to the delivery schedule included in Annex No. 1 to the ST in the quantities of individual parts indicated in Annex No. 1 to the ST. Within a given batch indicated in the above-mentioned schedule, the Ordering Party does not allow partial deliveries. The entirety of a given batch indicated in the above-mentioned schedule for a given Task must be performed as part of one delivery. 4. Subject The order will be fulfilled in accordance with the procedure documentation, i.e. SWZ and its annexes, in particular ST and the contract template (Appendix No. 2 to SWZ). 5. Whereas: 1) The Ordering Party purchased Inspiro metro vehicles without a license for their production (ex due to the costs of such proceedings), and therefore has not received and does not have construction and production documentation of vehicles or their parts; 2) use of parts other than those indicated in the ST attached to the SWZ, for which the procedure was not carried out modernization of vehicles described on the website of the Office of Rail Transport would violate the documents on the basis of which type tests of vehicles were carried out, which were the basis for admitting them to service.... input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: "ZIELONOGÓRSKIE WODOCIĄGI I KANALIZACJA" SP. Z O. O.. Summary: "Construction of Two Photovoltaic Installations at the Zawada Power Plant in Zielona Góra". Description: The subject of this order is the construction of a photovoltaic installation at the Zawada Water Treatment Station in Zielona Góra, divided into two stages, according to the design documentation: 1)Construction of a photovoltaic installation with a capacity of up to 160 kW at the Station Zawada Water Treatment Plant in Zielona Góra. The photovoltaic installation will be connected to the existing RG in the existing transformer station building. Designed photovoltaic installation due to its location and connection power, will consist of the following elements: photovoltaic cells on supporting structures in the amount of 286 pcs., 3 inverters with a total rated power of 150 kW. DC electrical installation three-phase electrical installation alternating 2)Construction of a photovoltaic installation with a capacity of up to 560 kW along with an energy storage facility with a capacity of 1,290 kWh at the Zawada Water Treatment Plant in Zielona Góra. The photovoltaic installation will be connected to the existing RG in the existing building transformer station, through the designed RN-W connector. The energy storage is designed as a prefabricated container structure consisting of the following elements: •concrete casing of the warehouse with a transformer chamber, •concrete foundation prefabricated, •LV and DC switchboards, •bidirectional AC/DC converter, •SPS-kontrol control system, •fire extinguishing system. •energy reservoir, •transformer, •concrete roof. Technological data of the station.... Published Date: 2025-12-22. Closing Date: 2026-01-15. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Summary: "Preparation and Delivery of Educational Packages for Conducting Classes in 115 Preschool Education Centers in the Bof Area "Integrated Program for the Development of Talents and Key Competencies in Preschool.... Description: "Preparation and delivery of educational packages for conducting classes in 115 Preschool Education Centers in the BOF area "Integrated Program for the Development of Talents and Key Competencies in Preschool... is to prepare and deliver 1,460 packages educational activities for children aged 5-6 years, carried out in 115 Preschool Education Centers (OWP) from 12 communes of the Białystok Functional Area (OWP) according to Annex No. 1 to OPZ. As part of the service, the Contractor will provide: (A) materials educational: art, office and toys; (B) graphic design and printing of materials, and (C) packaging of educational materials and printouts into "educational packages" and their delivery to the 115th OWP. Educational packages will serve OWP teachers until conducting 4 cycles of classes (so-called Bofka missions), one mission in each of the 4 competence groups: (1) language and culture, (2) modern technologies, (3) healthy development, (4) entrepreneurship - 8 classes in each mission (Cultural Mission, Technological Mission, Mission Ecological and Business Mission) - a total of 32 classes. The "educational package" (1,460 pieces) should be understood as a "classroom package" (1,000 pieces) and a "kindergarten package" (460 pieces) packed in a resealable cardboard box and opening during 8 activities carried out during one mission and storing them in stacks of at least 5 boxes. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: COMMUNE OF NOWE OSTROWY. Summary: Modernization of the Building in Order to Adapt Rooms for the Purposes of Establishing and Operating the Social Services Center (Cus) and Adapting Rooms for People with Disabilities. Description: The subject of the order is the implementation of construction works consisting in the expansion of part of the ground floor of the existing public library building and the adaptation of newly designed rooms for the needs of the Social Services Center (CUS). The scope of the investment includes expansion the ground floor of the existing, free-standing library building, with two above-ground floors (ground floor and attic) and a partial basement. The designed extension is a separate, single-story structure with a compact shape and structure. brick, covered with a single-pitch, flat roof with a slight slope, made using flat roof technology. As part of the expansion, two utility rooms for the CUS and a vestibule were designed, with an independent entrance from the south-east. Existing library functions in the rest of the building remain unchanged. After the expansion, the building's development area will be 285.75 m2, the volume will be 1,747.46 m2, and the usable area of ​​the building will be 473.45 m2. The subject of the order also includes the installation of a passenger lift. (elevators) along with the necessary construction, construction and installation works. The subject of the basic order is the supply of 22 (twenty-two) buses (12 articulated and 10 single-unit), brand new in the urban version, powered by diesel oil, meeting the EURO VI standard, year of production: not older than 2027, in form of financial leasing with option rights. 2. The buses offered must meet the conditions set out in the Act of June 20, 1997. Road Traffic Law (consolidated text: Journal of Laws 2024.1251), issued on the basis of the above-mentioned act, regulation of the Minister of Infrastructure of of 31 December 2002 on the technical conditions of vehicles and the scope of their necessary equipment (Journal of Laws 2024.502, as amended), UN/ECE Regulation No. 107 - uniform provisions concerning the approval of vehicles of categories M2 and M3 with regard to their construction general (Journal of Laws EU.L.2018.52.1 of February 23, 2018), have a vehicle type approval certificate issued in accordance with applicable regulations and meet the requirements of SWZ together with annexes. 3. Lease duration - 144 months (12 years), interest-bearing annual ratio, WIBOR 3M rate plus margin. 4. The Ordering Party, in accordance with Art. 441 of the Act on Public Procurement, provides for the possibility of exercising the option right once during the term of the Agreement, consisting in extending the scope of the order to include supplies in the form of leasing financial single-section buses up to 8 pieces, brand new, diesel-powered, meeting the EURO VI standard, year of production no older than 2027. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: HEALTH CARE COMPLEX IN OŁAWA. Summary: Delivery of Disposable Medical Equipment. Description: 1. Quantities, characteristics and technical and operational parameters the subject of the order is specified in Annexes No. 1, 5, 5a, 5d and 9 to the terms of reference (SWZ). 4. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: KOLUSZKI COMMUNE. Summary: Collection and Management of Municipal Waste from Property Owners Living in the Koluszki Commune. Description: The subject of the contract is the provision of services consisting in the collection and management of separately collected municipal waste and mixed waste from real estate where residents live and from real estate where there are: cottages holiday homes or other properties used for recreational purposes, used only for part of the year. Approximate amounts of individual types of waste are included in the unit price form constituting Annex 2 to the Specification Order Terms. The total estimated amount of waste is: 19,010 Mg. The detailed scope of the order includes: 1) Collection and management of municipal waste from inhabited properties according to the implementation schedule, 2) Collection and management of waste from PSZOK in Koluszki, 3) Preparing monthly reports to monitor the services provided and inform the Ordering Party about any: problems and irregularities noticed during the provision of municipal waste collection services, 4) Preparing and submitting annual reports to the Ordering Party in accordance with Chapter 4b of the Act of September 13, 1996 on maintaining cleanliness and order in municipalities (consolidated text: Journal of Laws of 2023, item 1469). Place of implementation: the entire area of ​​the Koluszki Commune the following towns: Koluszki, Będzelin, Borowa, Długie, Erazmów, Felicjanów, Gałków Duży, Gałków Mały, Gałkówek Parcela, Jeziorko, Kazdrowien, Katarzynów, Kazimierzów, Koluszki, Leosin, Lisowice, Now.... Published Date: 2025-12-19. Closing Date: 2026-01-05. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: PROVINCIAL POLICE HEADQUARTERS IN KATOWICE. Summary: Purchase and Delivery of Light Fuel Oil Intended for Heating Purposes for Local Police Units of the Silesian Garrison. Description: The subject of the order is the purchase and delivery of light fuel oil intended for heating purposes for local police units of the Silesian garrison. Estimated demand for light fuel oil intended for heating purposes across the board order amount is 357.4 cubic meters. The demand for tasks and the capacity of tanks in given local units are specified in Annex No. 3 to the SWZ - List of units with boiler rooms fired with light fuel oil along with the capacity tanks located on the units' premises and the planned number of deliveries. The given quantities are only indicative quantities for the purpose of selecting the Contractor, and the value of the contract for each task will be the amount that the Ordering Party intends to allocate for financing of a given task given before the opening of offers. The order was divided into 9 parts (tasks). The gross offer price calculated in accordance with the instructions of section XVII of the SWZ, entered in Annex No. 1 to the SWZ - the offer form for each task separately, it will be used by the Ordering Party to select the most advantageous offer based on section XX of the SWZ. If the price of the most advantageous offer exceeds the amount that the Ordering Party intended to spend on the task, the Ordering Party will decide whether it will concluded an agreement up to the amount of funds available, whether it would increase the funds allocated for implementation or cancel the proceedings. Additional information regarding the description of the subject of the order and its scope can be found in: attachment.... Published Date: 2025-12-19. Closing Date: 2026-01-20. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: JABŁONNA COMMUNE. Summary: Comprehensive Supply and Sale of Gas Fuel for the Needs of the Jabłonna Municipality. Description: "Comprehensive delivery and sale of gas fuel for the needs of the Jabłonna Commune from March 1, 2026 to December 31, 2027" The subject of the order is the supply of high-methane natural gas for a period of 22 months, from March 1, 2026 to December 31, 2027, including the sale and distribution of gas for facilities managed by the Jabłonna Commune. The order includes 18 consumption points for which the Ordering Party expects a total consumption over a period of 22 months, i.e. from March 1, 2026 to December 31, 2027 (22 months from the date of conclusion of the contract) in amounting to 4087.51 MWh. The order includes 18 collection points for which the Ordering Party provides in total consumption over a period of 22 months, i.e. from March 1, 2026 to December 31, 2027 (22 months from the date of conclusion of the contract) in the amount of 4,087.51 MWh. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: ZŁOTÓW COMMUNE. Summary: Delivery of Wood Pellets in 2026.. Description: The subject of the order is the successive delivery of wood pellets to the Commune Office, village halls and the Primary School in Święta and the Primary School in Kleszczyna, with a total volume of deliveries of approximately 105.0 tons. The Ordering Party stipulates that the indicated amount of fuel is an estimate, used to calculate the offer price, compare the offer and select the best offer. The ordering party reserves the right to reduce the total order quantity by 20%. The contractor with whom the ordering party signs a contract is not entitled to a claim for implementation deliveries in the amounts specified in the offer form. The Contractor will be obliged to provide pellets of the appropriate (required) quality, made of wood from coniferous or deciduous trees, or a mixture of coniferous and deciduous trees, without any admixture of other substances, such as: adhesives, binders or hardeners, in the form of cylinders with a diameter of 6 to 8 mm (for the boiler room of the Zotów Commune Office, pellets of 6 mm diameter) and a length of up to 40 mm, with parameters not worse than: - calorific value 17.00 [MJ/kg], - average density 600 [kg/m3], - humidity 10%, - ash content 0.7%. The offered pellet must have the ENPlus A1 certificate.. Published Date: 2025-12-19. Closing Date: 2025-12-29. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed
